# Datum

Common coordiante systems include:  

- *Longitude & Latitude* - A deviation in degrees from a fixed point.  

- *Universal Trans Mercator* - Based upon the meter.

- *Local Planar Coordinates* - May be in common dimensions (*ft* or *m*)

# Point Data

# The `sf` Library

The `sf` library allows you to embed *Simple Features* (POINTS, LINES, POLYGONS, etc) within a `data.frame` object directly.  When you load in the library

```{r}
library( sf )
```


it also loads in components from:

- GEOS is the *Geometry Engine - Open Source* library
 
- GDAL is a translator library for raster and vector geospatial data formats.

- PROJ is a generic coordinate transformation software that transforms geospatial coordinates from one coordinate reference system (CRS) to another. 


---

# Load in Some Data

The Sonoran Desert bark beetle data.

```{r}
library( readr )
url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dyerlab/ENVS-Lectures/master/data/arapat.csv"
data <- read_csv( url )
```

```{r}
summary( data )
```

---

```{r fig.align="center"}
library( ggplot2 )
ggplot( data, aes(Longitude,Latitude) ) + geom_point() + coord_map()
```



---

# Converting to Simple Features


```{r}
pts <- st_as_sf( data, coords = c("Longitude","Latitude"), crs= 3857 )
summary( pts )
```

--

```{r}
class( pts )
```



---

# Converting to Simple Features

```{r}
head( pts )
```
